dcterms:title: Mallory-Denk bodies and hepatocellular senescence: a causal relationship?
dcterms:abstract: Mallory-Denk bodies (MDBs) are hepatocellular cytoplasmic inclusions occurring in chronic liver diseases, with implications in senescence and chronic stress. This study investigates the relationship between MDB formation and the expression of senescence markers, suggesting a complex role in liver pathology.
